availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Harris (Union County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Blakesley Harris in Union County, Kentucky, in April 1857. Farmer in Union County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Farmer in Union County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Union County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 512A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 401A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Uniontown, p. 396B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Union County Marriages, Film 000562203.
"Thomas J. Harris (1820-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial 106790961, accessed August 29, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106790961.
